description: A union representing thousands of University of California faculty members said it’s pushing back against the institution’s plans to comply with a federal subpoena tied to an investigation into allegations of antisemitism.
title: UC Faculty Union Fights Federal Subpoena in Antisemitism Probe

description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese described the US announcement of a 10% tariff on Australian goods as a “poor decision,” while saying that he will not respond with reciprocal levies.
title: Australia PM Says 10% US Tariff a ‘Poor Decision,’ Won’t Respond

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent indicated that the federal government is at risk of running out of room to make good on all of its payment obligations on time as soon as May or June.
title: Bessent Signals US on Debt-Limit ‘Warning Track’ for May or June

description: The UK refrained from retaliation and said it would maintain its push for a US trade deal after President Donald Trump slapped tariffs of 10% on all imports from Britain as part of a wider global package which he dubbed “Liberation Day” for his country.
title: UK to Keep Pushing for a Trade Deal After Trump’s 10% Tariffs

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Edward Harrison, author of Bloomberg’s Everything Risk newsletter, assesses the market reaction to the president’s tariffs. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: How Markets Are Assessing Trump's Grand Tariff Experiment

description: President Donald Trump is imposing tariffs on US trading partners worldwide, his biggest assault yet on a global economic system he has long bemoaned as unfair.
title: Trump to Impose 10% Global Tariff, Higher Rates for Some Nations

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde called for an overhaul of how European Union decisions are taken, proposing that majority voting should be embraced to make the bloc more competitive.
title: Lagarde Says EU Must Embrace Majority Voting Over Veto Power

description: Former Harvard University President Lawrence Summers blasted moves by the Trump administration to scrutinize or freeze federal funding to top universities as “authoritarian,” and urged academic leaders to resist.
title: Summers Blasts Trump Threat to Harvard Funds as ‘Authoritarian’

description: Senate Republicans unveiled a budget blueprint designed to fast-track a renewal of President Donald Trump’s tax cuts and an increase to the nation’s borrowing limit, ahead of a planned vote on the resolution later this week.
title: Senate Unveils Plan to Fast-Track Tax Cuts, Debt Ceiling Hike

description: The dirtiest coal-fired power plant in the US is asking Donald Trump for a waiver from pollution mandates, taking up the administration on an offer to email for a chance to get a presidential exemption.
title: Dirtiest US Coal-Fired Power Plant Applies for EPA Exemption

description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission will reorganize 10 regional offices under broader geographic areas and decrease the number of people reporting directly to the agency’s enforcement director, acting Chair Mark Uyeda said in a staff-wide email Wednesday.
title: SEC to Restructure Regional Offices to Streamline Management

description: Tractor trailers cross into the US at the Ysleta-Zaragoza International Bridge port of entry, on the US-Mexico border in Juarez, Chihuahua state, Mexico, on Wednesday, April 2, 2025. Trump on April 2 plans to roll out tariffs on global trading partners during an event planned for 4 p.m. in the White House Rose Garden, the centerpiece of his effort to bring back manufacturing to the US and reshape a world trade system he has long decried as unfair.
title: Trump to Announce Reciprocal Tariffs at Rose Garden Event

description: Tesla Inc. investors shrugged off the company’s worst vehicle sales since 2022 and bid up its shares on hopes that Elon Musk will step back from his work for the Trump administration.
title: Tesla Shares Rally on Hopes Elon Musk Will Refocus on Carmaker

description: Business leaders have pledged at least $1.6 trillion in US spending since Trump was elected to a second term as president. If history is any guide, not all of it will materialize.
title: Trump’s $1.6 Trillion Corporate Pledge Parade: What’s Real, What’s Not

description: President Donald Trump’s administration rejected concerns that accused Venezuelan gang members deported under the Alien Enemies Act are at risk of torture in a notorious El Salvador prison.
title: Deported Venezuelans Not at Risk of Torture in El Salvador Prison, US Says

description: Leaders of South Africa’s Democratic Alliance will meet to discuss its involvement in the nation’s coalition government after lawmakers passed a budget framework that second-biggest party opposed.
title: Leaders of South Africa’s DA to Meet on Future of ANC Coalition

description: US special envoy Steve Witkoff is expected to meet in Washington with senior Russian negotiator Kirill Dmitriev, according to a person familiar with the plans, an effort to smooth over tensions after President Donald Trump vented frustration with counterpart Vladimir Putin.
title: Russian Negotiator Dmitriev to Meet Envoy Witkoff in Washington

description: After months of turmoil, Eric Adams’ personal liberty is for now secure. But the political future for New York City’s mayor remains in peril.
title: NYC Mayor Faces Prospect of Political Defeat After Legal Victory

description: South Africa’s parliament approved a key piece of budget legislation despite objections from the second-biggest party in the coalition government, raising the risk of the alliance unraveling.
title: South Africa Coalition at Risk After Parliament Backs Budget Law

description: British rock group Muse postponed an upcoming concert in Istanbul after fans objected to the involvement of DBL Entertainment, a Turkish events company whose owner criticized a boycott related to recent anti-government protests.
title: British Band Muse Delays Turkey Concert as Boycott Row Escalates

description: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke with his Spanish counterpart Jose Manuel Albares for around 30 minutes on Wednesday, according to a person briefed on the conversation.
title: Rubio Holds Call With Spanish Foreign Minister to Discuss Trade

description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana criticized the Democratic Alliance over its plan to oppose a key piece of budget legislation, and suggested that if the party does object it should quit the nation’s coalition government.
title: South Africa Finance Minister Slams Democratic Alliance Over Budget

description: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss whether the countries in the firing line of America’s latest tariffs should have seen this coming.
title: The Roots of Trump’s Global Trade War

description: Eliezer Mishory, the former chief regulatory officer of derivatives exchange Kalshi Inc., is leading the DOGE team at the US Securities and Exchange Commission, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
title: Kalshi’s Top Lawyer Quits to Take Helm of DOGE Team at SEC

description: The UK will be hit by the global impact of US tariffs even if ministers succeed in their mission to secure an exemption for British goods, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said.
title: Reeves Says Trump’s Tariffs Will Hurt UK Even If Britain Secures US Deal

description: Iran’s foreign minister reiterated a willingness to engage in indirect negotiations with US President Donald Trump’s administration over the country’s nuclear program.
title: Iran Reiterates Willingness for Indirect Nuclear Talks With US

description: Canadian Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre says his government would push for an urgent renegotiation of the US-Mexico-Canada Agreement, and all revenues collected from increased trade with the US would fund expanding Canada’s military.
title: Poilievre Pitches Expanding US Trade to Fund Canada’s Military

description: Repairing the fractured relationship between South Africa and the US hinges on balanced trade, according to business and labor leaders from the continent’s biggest economy who met with American politicians in Washington.
title: US Urges Visiting South Africa Business Leaders to Balance Trade

description: Republican senators will soon be forced to do something they’ve avoided: take a public stand on the trade war President Donald Trump is instigating.
title: GOP Senators Forced by Democrats to Take Stand in Trade War Vote

description: The European Union is preparing a package of potential emergency measures to support parts of its economy that could be hit the hardest by US President Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Eyes Emergency Plans to Shield Economy From Trump Tariffs

description: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said European militaries should “step up” as the US tilts away from the region to focus more on threats from Asia.
title: NATO Chief Urges Europe to ‘Step Up’ as US Turns Toward Asia

description: US companies last month announced the fewest stock buybacks, in dollar terms, since the Covid pandemic, an early sign of cash hoarding from worries about economic growth and the impact of a global trade war.
title: Corporate America Hoards Cash for Tariffs Over Buying Back Stock

description: Calley Means, a White House adviser working on implementing Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s chronic disease agenda, was booed, shouted down and laughed at during a health conference while defending mass layoffs at the agency.
title: White House Official Booed at Conference for Defending Health Agency Cuts

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told officials from some of the world’s biggest banks that their help is a vital part of the Trump administration’s push to ratchet up economic pressure on Iran.
title: Bessent Pushes Banks for Help Enforcing Maximum Pressure on Iran

description: The US Supreme Court largely sided with the Food and Drug Administration in its rejection of applications to sell flavored vaping products, backing actions the agency took during Joe Biden’s presidency amid uncertainty about the approach it will take under Donald Trump.
title: Supreme Court Largely Backs Biden-Era FDA on Flavored Vapes

description: Benjamin Netanyahu is set to arrive in Budapest on Thursday for meetings with Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban, with the pair ignoring the International Criminal Court’s warrant for the Israeli leader’s arrest.
title: Netanyahu and Orban Show Scorn for ICC With Planned Meeting

description: Former US Secretary of Health and Human Services Xavier Becerra is running for governor of California, joining a crowded field of Democrats vying to lead the biggest US state.
title: Becerra Joins Pack of Democrats in Race for California Governor

description: A day after Colombia’s president accused the central bank of economic sabotage for its refusal to cut interest rates, bank Governor Leonardo Villar said that dealing with political pressure is “part of the job.”
title: Colombia’s Top Central Banker Shrugs Off Attack by the President

description: Vehicle buyers in Canada are trying to beat the price hikes of a trade war, as the government of Prime Minister Mark Carney prepares to strike back against the latest fusillade of import taxes from the White House.
title: Trump’s Trade War Forces Canada Into Decision on Whether to Hit US Autos

description: A federal judge dismissed corruption charges against Eric Adams, bringing a permanent end to the case and capping an extraordinary series of events that sowed discord within the Justice Department.
title: NYC Mayor Adams’ Corruption Case Permanently Dismissed by Judge

description: Staff at the UK’s Office for National Statistics voted to continue industrial action, a fresh setback for the agency that comes just a day after the government launched an investigation into the quality of its data.
title: Staff at UK Statistics Body Vote to Extend Industrial Action

description: Todos los días se forman largas filas frente a dispensarios farmacéuticos en grandes ciudades del país, y la industria y el gobierno se culpan mutuamente por la creciente crisis.
title: Salud de los colombianos está en riesgo por crisis en el sistema

description: At a December lunch in Paris, one senior executive approached the young and charismatic president of the far right National Rally and pulled him aside.
title: Le Pen’s Lifeline Forces 29-Year-Old Heir to Wait for His Moment

description: China’s embassy in Bangkok urged a construction company to cooperate with Thai authorities in a probe into the crash of a skyscraper during an earthquake last week, which has now widened to the firm’s other business operations in the Southeast Asian country.
title: China Urges Firm to Join Widening Thai Probe Into Crashed Tower

description: China’s No. 3 military official appeared to have missed an annual gathering in Beijing, a rare absence that comes amid speculation he’s the latest target of President Xi Jinping’s anti-corruption purges.
title: China’s No. 3 Military Chief Missing From High-Profile Event

description: Namibia’s President Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah held talks with Russian Deputy Prime Minister Yury Trutnev seeking to boost cooperation on nuclear energy in Africa’s biggest uranium producer.
title: Namibia Holds Talks With Russia Over Nuclear Energy Partnership

description: China has taken steps to restrict local companies from investing in the US, according to people familiar with the matter, in a move that could give Beijing more leverage for potential trade negotiations with the Trump administration.
title: China Restricts Companies From Investing in US as Tensions Rise

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Is Coming Around to Xi’s Way of Thinking

description: Long lines form daily outside medical dispensaries in Bogotá and other major cities, with industry and government blaming each other for the growing crisis.
title: Patients Are Being Denied Medicines in Festering Colombia Health Crisis

description: Michigan State Senator Mallory McMorrow, whose fiery floor speech gained national attention in 2022, announced that she will run for the US Senate seat being vacated by retiring Democrat Gary Peters.
title: McMorrow Enters Michigan Senate Race, Targets Working Class

description: France’s government will revise down its growth forecast for 2025, less than two months after finalizing the budget, a junior minister said.
title: France’s 2025 Economic Growth Forecast to Be Cut, Minister Says

description: Greece will spend €25 billion ($27 billion) on defense equipment over the next 12 years, as the government seeks to reinforce the nation’s military capabilities and boost its domestic industry.
title: Greece to Spend €25 Billion on Defense Over Next 12 Years

description: France’s National Rally plans to protest against what it has called the “tyranny of judges” even after an appeals court said in a surprise statement late Tuesday that it should be able to rule by mid-2026 on a challenge by Marine Le Pen over her conviction this week.
title: French Far Right to Keep Up Pressure As Le Pen Gets Lifeline

description: BANGKOK (AP) — Myanmar's ruling military declared a temporary ceasefire in the country's civil war Wednesday to facilitate relief efforts following a 7.7 magnitude earthquake that has killed more than 3,000 people.
title: Myanmar's Ruling Military Declares Ceasefire to Facilitate Quake Relief Efforts

description: Uncertainty about a key vote on South Africa’s budget and what it portends for South Africa’s coalition government triggered a slump in the rand and bonds.
title: South African Budget Unease Triggers Rand Slump as Vote Looms

description: China’s ruling Communist Party has abruptly switched the roles of two Politburo members, according to the South China Morning Post, an unprecedented move that comes as Xi Jinping breaks personnel norms in his third term.
title: Xi Abruptly Shuffles Politburo in Unprecedented Move, SCMP Says

description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu hired the former head of a unit of Shell Plc to run the state oil company, as Africa’s biggest crude producer works to boost output and prepare the firm for an initial public offering.
title: Nigeria Hires Ex-CEO of Shell Unit to Lead State Oil Company

description: Vietnam plans to send another top official and business delegation to the US this weekend in a sign of the furious behind-the-scenes activity taking place as the world braces for Donald Trump’s rollout of reciprocal tariffs.
title: Vietnam to Send Deputy PM on Last-Minute US Trip as Tariffs Loom

description: China highlighted US farmers and tech companies as beneficiaries of economic ties in the ruling Communist Party’s official newspaper, in an apparent appeal to cool trade tensions on the eve of Donald Trump’s expected announcement of new global tariffs.
title: China Touts Trade Benefits for US in Last-Ditch Tariff Appeal

description: The Trump administration’s plan to challenge China’s maritime dominance and usher through a change in the shipbuilding industry will likely be a decades-long effort, according to the chief of the Port of Los Angeles.
title: Trump’s Bid to Weaken China’s Maritime Heft May Take ‘Decades’

description: Israel is expanding military operations in Gaza, days after ordering people in southern parts of the Palestinian territory to leave in preparation for more intense conflict with Hamas.
title: Israel Expands Ground Operations Against Hamas in Gaza

description: Spain ranks first in Europe for clinical trials and is attracting investment in life sciences, but faces intense competition including from China.
title: How Spain Became Big Pharma’s New Hotspot in Europe

description: A group of lesser-discussed greenhouse gasses is many times more powerful than CO2. Cracking down on them can provide immediate results.
title: The World Is Waking Up to the Dangers of Super Pollutants

description: China’s top diplomat called on the US to remove tariffs it imposed on Chinese goods for Beijing’s alleged role in America’s fentanyl crisis before holding any talks on the matter, deepening a stalemate weighing on trade ties between the world’s two largest economies.
title: China Ties US Talks to Tariff Removal as Stalemate Deepens

description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday is set to announce the most expansive US trade restrictions in a century, at a stroke upending the postwar global trading system and posing difficult-to-predict economic risks.
title: Trump Tariff Rollout Opens New Era of Risk for Global Economy

description: Myanmar’s military said it fired “warning shots” at a vehicle convoy from the Red Cross Society of China bringing aid to the central areas of the country devastated by Friday’s earthquake, which has killed more than 2,800 people.
title: Myanmar Military Fires ‘Warning Shots’ at Chinese Aid Convoy

description: Elon Musk’s candidate faced a resounding loss in a Wisconsin judicial race despite the world’s richest man pouring millions into the campaign, while Republicans avoided upsets in two critical US House seats in Donald Trump’s home state of Florida.
title: Democrat-Backed Judge Defeats Musk's Candidate in Wisconsin Court Race

description: China conducted a second day of drills around Taiwan on Wednesday, adding to the unprecedented military pressure it is applying to President Lai Ching-te, a leader it strongly dislikes.
title: China Simulates Port Strikes in Second Day of Taiwan Drills
